_comments.description: Claude Desktop configuration for SagasWeave NPM Test MCP Server
instructions: 1. Copy this file to your Claude Desktop configuration directory
2. Rename it to remove the .example extension
3. Update the absolute paths to match your system
5. Restart Claude Desktop to load the new configuration

environment_variables.SW_MCP_NPM_TEST_PROJECT_ROOT: Absolute path to your SagasWeave project root
environment_variables.SW_MCP_NPM_TEST_MAX_CONCURRENT: Maximum number of concurrent test processes (default: 3)
environment_variables.SW_MCP_NPM_TEST_TIMEOUT: Default timeout for test execution in milliseconds (default: 30000)

usage_examples.run_unit_tests: Ask Claude: 'Run unit tests for the backend workspace with coverage'
usage_examples.run_e2e_tests: Ask Claude: 'Run E2E tests in headed mode'
usage_examples.check_test_status: Ask Claude: 'What is the status of running tests?'
usage_examples.get_coverage: Ask Claude: 'Show me the coverage report for the backend'

troubleshooting.server_not_found: Ensure the path to index.js is correct and the file exists
troubleshooting.permission_denied: Make sure the index.js file is executable (chmod +x)
troubleshooting.project_not_found: Verify SW_MCP_NPM_TEST_PROJECT_ROOT points to a valid project directory
troubleshooting.tests_not_running: Check that npm scripts exist in the target workspace
